ARABIC: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ هَآؤُمُ ٱقْرَءُوا۟ كِتَٰبِيَهْ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: As for him who is given his Book in his right hand, he will say, 'Here, come and read my Book!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: He who is given his ledger in his right hand, will say: "Here, read my ledger.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: On that Day, he whose Record is given to him in his right hand will say: “Lo! Read my Record!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Those who will receive the books of the records of their deeds in their right hands will say, "Come and read my record.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So whoever is given his book in his right hand – he will say, “Take, read my account!”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then as for him who will be given his Record in his right hand will say: "Here! read my Record!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Then as for him who is given his book in his right hand, he will say: Lo! read my book:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Then as for him who is given his book in his right hand, he shall say, 'Here, take and read my book!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Then, as for him who is given his record in his right hand, he will say: Take, read my book!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Then he who is given his record in his right hand will exclaim, "Here is my record, read it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then as to him who will be vouchsafed his book in his right hand, he shall say: here! read my book!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: As for him who is given his book in his right hand, he will say, ‘Here, take and read my book!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Then he that will be given his Record in his right hand will say: "Ah here! Read ye my Record!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Then as for him who will be given his Record in his right hand will say: "Take, read my Record!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Then, he who is given his book in his right hand will say: 'Here, take and read my book!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: As for him who is given his book in his right hand, he will say, “Here, take my book and read it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So as for he who is given his record in his right hand, he will say, "Here, read my record!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [69:19] As for him who is given his book in his right hand, he will say, addressing those around him, on account of the joy that has come to him: ‘Here, take [and], read my book! (kitābiyah: both hā’ūmu, ‘here [is]’, and iqra’ū, ‘read’, compete for [government of] this [direct object]).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Then, as for him who is given his record in his right hand) this refers to Abu Salamah Ibn 'Abd al-Asad, the husband of Umm Salamah who was a Muslim, (he will say) to his companions: (Take, read my book!) come and see what is in my book of reward and bestowal of honour.
